content:
Here is my new design idea for the login and sign in page.
What do you all think?

olg_signin.jpg

new_login.jpg new_signin.jpg
Tagging @Vlad Korobov for your thoughts.
Good direction but a bit confusing... too much is going on.

The biggest question I have is why should there be sign up instead of just sign in? Why do we have those as a separate pages? Can't Zulip autodetect me on sign in page and if there is no such account suggest to create one?

We do that sort of thing if you try to login with social authentication when you don't have an account. But there's not an easy parallel for email/password authentication; for that, a "sign up" page should just ask for your email address, not also a password; and it's confusing to be presented with an email/password prompt when you don't have an account yet.

Vlad Korobov
Sorry for sending so many changes at once.
I will break it up into parts, and I would like to discuss this again after it.
@Tim Abbott agree, but what if login would start with only email input too?

Vlad Korobov said:

Tim Abbott agree, but what if login would start with only email input too?

That's an option, but it does slow down the login experience because password managers can't autofill both fields immediately for you, in addition to just needing to do an additional step.

As first I want to hear your thoughts @Vlad Korobov about social login buttons.

  • not repeat "log in with" or "sign up with"
  • use light border instead of box shadow
  • use grid layout to show every button at onetime (The screenshots were taken at a reduced size, but would normally stick out.)

before.jpg
after.jpg

@Taiki Choda thank you for paying your attention to this area of the Zulip app. I agree that it should be redesigned at some point.
Sorry, that right now we are not ready to provide some guidelines for design contribution.
We have an ongoing redesign initiative, so there is some style emerging out of that.
If you interested we could discuss that on a call so you could contribute with a proper context.
